title: Amazon CloudWatch Application Insights API with 27 operations
description:
Complete MCP server exposing 27 Amazon CloudWatch Application Insights API operations to AI agents. ## âš¡ Quick Setup Need help? Want access to more workflows and even live Q&A sessions with a top verified n8n creator.. All 100% free? [Join the community](https://www.skool.com/n8n-nodes-automation-lab-1570/about) 1. **Import** this workflow into your n8n instance 2. **Credentials** Add Amazon CloudWatch Application Insights credentials 3. **Activate** the workflow to start your MCP server 4. **Copy** the webhook URL from the MCP trigger node 5. **Connect** AI agents using the MCP URL ## ðŸ”§ How it Works This workflow converts the Amazon CloudWatch Application Insights API into an MCP-compatible interface for AI agents. â€¢ **MCP Trigger**: Serves as your server endpoint for AI agent requests â€¢ **HTTP Request Nodes**: Handle API calls to http://applicationinsights.{region}.amazonaws.com â€¢ **AI Expressions**: Automatically populate parameters via `$fromAI()` placeholders â€¢ **Native Integration**: Returns responses directly to the AI agent ## ðŸ“‹ Available Operations (27 total) ### ðŸ”§ #X-Amz-Target=Ec2Windowsbarleyservice.Createapplication (1 endpoints) â€¢ **POST /#X-Amz-Target=EC2WindowsBarleyService.CreateApplication**: Adds an application that is created from a resource group. ### ðŸ”§ #X-Amz-Target=Ec2Windowsbarleyservice.Createcomponent (1 endpoints) â€¢ **POST /#X-Amz-Target=EC2WindowsBarleyService.CreateComponent**: Creates a custom component by grouping similar standalone instances to monitor. ### ðŸ”§ #X-Amz-Target=Ec2Windowsbarleyservice.Createlogpattern (1 endpoints) â€¢ **POST /#X-Amz-Target=EC2WindowsBarleyService.CreateLogPattern**: Adds an log pattern to a LogPatternSet. ### ðŸ”§ #X-Amz-Target=Ec2Windowsbarleyservice.Deleteapplication (1 endpoints) â€¢ **POST /#X-Amz-Target=EC2WindowsBarleyService.DeleteApplication**: Removes the specified application from monitoring. Does not delete the application. ### ðŸ”§ #X-Amz-Target=Ec2Windowsbarleyservice.Deletecomponent (1 endpoints) â€¢ **POST /#X-Amz-Target=EC2WindowsBarleyService.DeleteComponent**: Ungroups a custom component. When you ungroup custom components, all applicable monitors that are set up for the component are removed and the instances revert to their standalone status. ### ðŸ”§ #X-Amz-Target=Ec2Windowsbarleyservice.Deletelogpattern (1 endpoints) â€¢ **POST /#X-Amz-Target=EC2WindowsBarleyService.DeleteLogPattern**: Removes the specified log pattern from a LogPatternSet. ### ðŸ”§ #X-Amz-Target=Ec2Windowsbarleyservice.Describeapplication (1 endpoints) â€¢ **POST /#X-Amz-Target=EC2WindowsBarleyService.DescribeApplication**: Describes the application. ### ðŸ”§ #X-Amz-Target=Ec2Windowsbarleyservice.Describecomponent (1 endpoints) â€¢ **POST /#X-Amz-Target=EC2WindowsBarleyService.DescribeComponent**: Describes a component and lists the resources that are grouped together in a component. ### ðŸ”§ #X-Amz-Target=Ec2Windowsbarleyservice.Describecomponentconfiguration (1 endpoints) â€¢ **POST /#X-Amz-Target=EC2WindowsBarleyService.DescribeComponentConfiguration**: Describes the monitoring configuration of the component. ### ðŸ”§ #X-Amz-Target=Ec2Windowsbarleyservice.Describecomponentconfigurationrecommendation (1 endpoints) â€¢ **POST /#X-Amz-Target=EC2WindowsBarleyService.DescribeComponentConfigurationRecommendation**: Describes the recommended monitoring configuration of the component. ### ðŸ”§ #X-Amz-Target=Ec2Windowsbarleyservice.Describelogpattern (1 endpoints) â€¢ **POST /#X-Amz-Target=EC2WindowsBarleyService.DescribeLogPattern**: Describe a specific log pattern from a LogPatternSet. ### ðŸ”§ #X-Amz-Target=Ec2Windowsbarleyservice.Describeobservation (1 endpoints) â€¢ **POST /#X-Amz-Target=EC2WindowsBarleyService.DescribeObservation**: Describes an anomaly or error with the application. ### ðŸ”§ #X-Amz-Target=Ec2Windowsbarleyservice.Describeproblem (1 endpoints) â€¢ **POST /#X-Amz-Target=EC2WindowsBarleyService.DescribeProblem**: Describes an application problem. ### ðŸ”§ #X-Amz-Target=Ec2Windowsbarleyservice.Describeproblemobservations (1 endpoints) â€¢ **POST /#X-Amz-Target=EC2WindowsBarleyService.DescribeProblemObservations**: Describes the anomalies or errors associated with the problem. ### ðŸ”§ #X-Amz-Target=Ec2Windowsbarleyservice.Listapplications (1 endpoints) â€¢ **POST /#X-Amz-Target=EC2WindowsBarleyService.ListApplications**: Lists the IDs of the applications that you are monitoring. ### ðŸ”§ #X-Amz-Target=Ec2Windowsbarleyservice.Listcomponents (1 endpoints) â€¢ **POST /#X-Amz-Target=EC2WindowsBarleyService.ListComponents**: Lists the auto-grouped, standalone, and custom components of the application. ### ðŸ”§ #X-Amz-Target=Ec2Windowsbarleyservice.Listconfigurationhistory (1 endpoints) â€¢ **POST /#X-Amz-Target=EC2WindowsBarleyService.ListConfigurationHistory**:

Lists the INFO, WARN, and ERROR events for periodic configuration updates performed by Application Insights. Examples of events represented are:

  • INFO: creating a new alarm or updating an alarm threshold.

  • WARN: alarm not created due to insufficient data points used to predict thresholds.

  • ERROR: alarm not created due to permission errors or exceeding quotas.

### ðŸ”§ #X-Amz-Target=Ec2Windowsbarleyservice.Listlogpatternsets (1 endpoints) â€¢ **POST /#X-Amz-Target=EC2WindowsBarleyService.ListLogPatternSets**: Lists the log pattern sets in the specific application. ### ðŸ”§ #X-Amz-Target=Ec2Windowsbarleyservice.Listlogpatterns (1 endpoints) â€¢ **POST /#X-Amz-Target=EC2WindowsBarleyService.ListLogPatterns**: Lists the log patterns in the specific log LogPatternSet. ### ðŸ”§ #X-Amz-Target=Ec2Windowsbarleyservice.Listproblems (1 endpoints) â€¢ **POST /#X-Amz-Target=EC2WindowsBarleyService.ListProblems**: Lists the problems with your application. ### ðŸ”§ #X-Amz-Target=Ec2Windowsbarleyservice.Listtagsforresource (1 endpoints) â€¢ **POST /#X-Amz-Target=EC2WindowsBarleyService.ListTagsForResource**: Retrieve a list of the tags (keys and values) that are associated with a specified application. A tag is a label that you optionally define and associate with an application. Each tag consists of a required tag key and an optional associated tag value. A tag key is a general label that acts as a category for more specific tag values. A tag value acts as a descriptor within a tag key. ### ðŸ”§ #X-Amz-Target=Ec2Windowsbarleyservice.Tagresource (1 endpoints) â€¢ **POST /#X-Amz-Target=EC2WindowsBarleyService.TagResource**:

Add one or more tags (keys and values) to a specified application. A tag is a label that you optionally define and associate with an application. Tags can help you categorize and manage application in different ways, such as by purpose, owner, environment, or other criteria.

Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated tag value, both of which you define. A tag key is a general label that acts as a category for more specific tag values. A tag value acts as a descriptor within a tag key.

### ðŸ”§ #X-Amz-Target=Ec2Windowsbarleyservice.Untagresource (1 endpoints) â€¢ **POST /#X-Amz-Target=EC2WindowsBarleyService.UntagResource**: Remove one or more tags (keys and values) from a specified application. ### ðŸ”§ #X-Amz-Target=Ec2Windowsbarleyservice.Updateapplication (1 endpoints) â€¢ **POST /#X-Amz-Target=EC2WindowsBarleyService.UpdateApplication**: Updates the application. ### ðŸ”§ #X-Amz-Target=Ec2Windowsbarleyservice.Updatecomponent (1 endpoints) â€¢ **POST /#X-Amz-Target=EC2WindowsBarleyService.UpdateComponent**: Updates the custom component name and/or the list of resources that make up the component. ### ðŸ”§ #X-Amz-Target=Ec2Windowsbarleyservice.Updatecomponentconfiguration (1 endpoints) â€¢ **POST /#X-Amz-Target=EC2WindowsBarleyService.UpdateComponentConfiguration**: Updates the monitoring configurations for the component. The configuration input parameter is an escaped JSON of the configuration and should match the schema of what is returned by DescribeComponentConfigurationRecommendation. ### ðŸ”§ #X-Amz-Target=Ec2Windowsbarleyservice.Updatelogpattern (1 endpoints) â€¢ **POST /#X-Amz-Target=EC2WindowsBarleyService.UpdateLogPattern**: Adds a log pattern to a LogPatternSet. ## ðŸ¤– AI Integration **Parameter Handling**: AI agents automatically provide values for: â€¢ Path parameters and identifiers â€¢ Query parameters and filters â€¢ Request body data â€¢ Headers and authentication **Response Format**: Native Amazon CloudWatch Application Insights API responses with full data structure **Error Handling**: Built-in n8n HTTP request error management ## ðŸ’¡ Usage Examples Connect this MCP server to any AI agent or workflow: â€¢ **Claude Desktop**: Add MCP server URL to configuration â€¢ **Cursor**: Add MCP server SSE URL to configuration â€¢ **Custom AI Apps**: Use MCP URL as tool endpoint â€¢ **API Integration**: Direct HTTP calls to MCP endpoints ## âœ¨ Benefits â€¢ **Zero Setup**: No parameter mapping or configuration needed â€¢ **AI-Ready**: Built-in `$fromAI()` expressions for all parameters â€¢ **Production Ready**: Native n8n HTTP request handling and logging â€¢ **Extensible**: Easily modify or add custom logic > ðŸ†“ **[Free for community use](https://github.com/Cfomodz/community-use)!** Ready to deploy in under 2 minutes.
